intro: Layia paniculata, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its bright orange or yellow flowers and feathery leaves. The plant is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in coastal areas. Layia paniculata is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
